text.section:
The tax collector shall:
Investigate each claim for refund; and
Conduct a hearing at the request of the claimant prior to a final determination on the claim.

section.section: If the tax collector determines that a claim for refund should be allowed, either in whole or in part, the tax collector shall forward the claim to the chief fiscal officer for approval.
If the chief fiscal officer does not approve the claim, the chief fiscal officer shall give the tax collector notice of the disapproval.
A claim for refund may not be approved unless all other State, county, or municipal corporation taxes, fees, and charges due by the person entitled to the refund have been paid.

text.section:
The tax collector shall give the claimant notice of:
The determination of the claim for refund; and
Any delay in paying an allowed claim.

section.section: Except as provided in paragraph (2) of this subsection, within 30 days after the date on which a notice is mailed, a person who is aggrieved by the action in the notice may appeal to the Maryland Tax Court in the manner allowed in Title 13, Subtitle 5, Parts IV and V of the Tax - General Article.

If a tax collector does not make a determination on a claim for refund within 6 months after the claim is filed, the claimant may:
Consider the claim as being disallowed; and
Appeal the disallowance to the Tax Court.
